titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York private libraries scrapbook 1977.116
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T15:59-0500

did.abstract: One scrapbook of clippings of a regular Saturday Evening Post column featuring news on private libraries in New York City and profiles of private library collections. Also contains clippings from various newspapers of literary stories and miscellany, as well as general national and international news. Clippings date from circa 1855 to 1860. The scrapbook contains a bookplate indicating that it had belonged to a Dr. Wynne, presumably of New York City.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); New York private libraries scrapbook, 1977.116, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
